definitions.definition: A literary device of writing or art which principally ridicules its subject often as an intended means of provoking or preventing change or highlighting a shortcoming in the work of another. Imitation , humor , irony , and exaggeration are often used to aid this.

examples: a stinging satire of American politics.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) A literary device of writing or art which principally ridicules its subject often as an intended means of provoking or preventing change or highlighting a shortcoming in the work of another. Imitation , humor , irony , and exaggeration are often used to aid this.
